p: To complement our ongoing work on the locally-encountered halophytic plants, their constituents, and bioactivities in general, and the traditionally-claimed health-benefits and pharmacological properties, investigations on Haloxylon, Cichorium, Tamarix, Ipomea, Zygophyllum, Styrax, and Suaeda [ 10, 23, 24], together with S. cyclophylla were planned. The current study was designed to investigate the anti-inflammatory and analgesic activities of S. cyclophylla extracts and their related phytochemical constituents and anti-oxidant potentials. S. cyclophylla was of particular interest due to its immense nutritional and folklore-based anti-inflammation and pain removal applications.
